intro: Tarachia stereophylla, commonly known as the desert spoon, is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, featuring a thick, fleshy stem that stores water. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, white or pale purple flowers in late spring. Its distinctive appearance makes it a popular choice for xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value. The plant also serves as a food source for various desert wildlife.
